comment: Professor Anderson is so sweet and will literally answer any question you have whether its about lecture or lab. I used to think i was horrible at chemistry but her tests are so straightforward. She curved all of our tests (and the ACS) and gave plenty of extra credit opportunities. Just go over key concepts and the practice problems she posts.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Anderson was great! She was always assessable outside of class times and was good at reminding students of due dates. Chemistry is hard, but she made it bearable. She offers extra credit and I highly recommend taking advantage of that. Additionally the SI sessions were very helpful! TAKE HER!

She does a good job of helping students out. She gives extra credit since her exams are so difficult. You HAVE to read the textbook. Simply looking at her powerpoionts will not allow you to pass her tests. Curved acs exam, which was impossible. I would take her again. She wants her students to succeed, which is a rarity at this school

Professor Anderson tried to do her best considering its her first year at KSU. She made changes and adapted to the class and helped students along the way. If you attend lectures, do her practice problems she does as review, and read the textbook chapters her class is straight forward. Also curved all our tests (including ACS final by 25%).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Class is difficult, must read book to pass class. Needs to give more extra credit because her tests are imposssible.

Comprehensive lectures, willing to help out of glass, hw on mastering chemistry, some extra credit opportunities, attending lectures covers what book covers, tests are easy if you either show up or read, would take again

Took her Fall 2017. She is a nice person but not a great Professor. There is hw, and 5 tests (one of them is dropped) and a final. She gives extra credit near the end of the semester. Chegg is really helpful in her class especially.

Dr. Anderson is a character for sure. If you email her and ask her questions or ask to meet in her office she is very nice. She is not very clear on what's she is teaching though. Her lectures are very repetitive but not on things that matter fr the tests. Examples don't help unless you actually ask her questions. Quizzes are difficult and online.

You have to read the textbook, but this is true with a lot of classes. She writes her tests around the textbook not the lectures, so if you want to pass you need to read the book. So everyone that says all she does is focus on lectures is right because she expects us to read and learn the material in the book, like most other professors.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests? Not many

comment: Shes super nice and helpful. As long as you do the homework and pass the exams you will pass the class. She drops the lowest exam grade, and towards the end of the year she gives you ton of extra credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Anderson is nice but not at all a great teacher. Does not actually teach, just reads PowerPoints. Doesnt answer specific questions clearly. All exams cover material that was never discussed in class. Worst professor Ive ever had. Im an A student with a 4.2 GPA and havent gotten above a 75 on a test in this class.

She reads off of powerpoints and doesn't teach. If you ask for her to do a problem, she'll occasionally groan and then use dried-out markers on the board and go through the steps- but won't explain it unless you ask. She teaches as if you know how to do everything, so she doesn't really teach. Homework is long and has things she didn't teach.
Tough grader on labs and very strict on detail. Take someone else. 70's on all labs and I'm an A student.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If you like to teach yourself the material, take her. If you struggle in understanding chemistry material, try to take someone else. She has 4 tests and a final. The class's average test scores for all of the test have been below a 70 so she curved all of them. There is MasteringChemistry hw but it is not too difficult and gives extra credit.
Don't take her for Lab. She's a strict grader anad most people do awful on the labs. stay away.

You only have 4 tests, and ACS final, and homework that takes many hours to complete. You must study for an entire week before the test to even attemptt to pass it. Tricky questions and not enough time to finish the tests. Don't recommend.
Her tests are extreemely difficult. Class avg on test 2 was 55. Nice teacher, but impossible tests. Take someone else.

Professor Anderson isn't the best teacher honestly, however this class is a breeze if you took chemistry in high school. Her tests are all multiple choice and she usually curves any tests that have a class average lower than a 70. Like I said it's an easy A if you remember a little bit from high school. Book and attendance not required, but helpful

She's a really nice lady, but her lectures are straight from the powerpoint, confusing, and occasionally wrong. You have to figure a lot of things out on your own. Not the worst professor out there, but your grade is 85% tests and you have to learn a lot for it on your own, but she is accessible.
